gurmukhi: suMdRw kwn DwrO swry muK pY ibBUiq fwrON hiT ko n hwrON pUq rwj swj jwir hON ]
transliteration: Mounndraa Kaan Dhaaraoun Sdare Moukh Pai Bibhoot(i) Daaraoun Hath(i) Ko Na Haaraoun Poot Raaj Saaj Daar(i) Haoun||
translation: I shall wear the rings in the ear and smear the ashes over my body. I shall live in persistence, O my son ! I shall forsake all the royal paraphernalia.

gurmukhi: jugIAw ko kIno bys kausl ky Cor kRys rwjw rwmcMd jUky sMig hI isDwir hON ]266]
transliteration: Jougeeaa Ko Keeno Bes Kaousal Ke Chhodh Kres Raajaa Raamchad Jooke San(i) Hisiddaar(i) Haoun||266||
translation: I shall adopt the garb of a yogi, and leaving Kaushal (country), I shall go with the king Ram.266.

gurmukhi: kwnny gy rwm ] Drm krmM Dwm ] l`ClY lY sMig ] jwnkI suBMig ]267]
transliteration: Kaanane Ge Raam|| Dharam Karamannd Dhaam|| Lachchhnai Lai San(i) Jaanakisoubhan(i)||267||
translation: Ram, the abode of religious action, went to the forest alongwith Lakshman and Janaki (Sita).267.

gurmukhi: qwq iqAwgy pRwn ] au`qry bXomwn ] ib`cry ibcwr ] mMqRIXM Apwr ]268]
transliteration: Taat Tiaage Praan|| Outtre Byomaan|| Bichchre Bichaar|| Mantreeyan Apaar||268||
translation: On that side the father breathed his last and left for heaven in and air-vehicle of gods. On this side, the ministers reflected on the situation.268.

gurmukhi: bYTXo bissit ] srb ib`p iest ] muk`ilXo kwgd ] p`Tey mwgD ]269]
transliteration: Baithyo Basisttee|| Sarab Bipp Ist|| Moukalliyo Kaagad|| Patthae Maagadh||269||
translation: The advice of vasishtha, the eminent Brahmin amongst all the Brahmins, was accepted. A letter was written and sent to Magadh.269.

gurmukhi: sMkVysw vMq ] m`qey m`qMq ] mu`kly ky dUq ] paun ky sy pUq ]270]
transliteration: Sankdesaa Vant|| Mattae Mattant|| Moukkle Ke Doot|| Paoun Ke Se Poot||270||
translation: A very brief discussion was held and several fast-moving messengers like Hanuman were sent.270.

gurmukhi: Astn dXMlwK ] dUq gy crbwK ] Brq Awgy jhwN ] jwq By qy qhwN ]271]
transliteration: Astan Dyanlaakh|| Doot Ge Charbaakh|| Bharat Aage Jahaan|| Jaat Bhe Te Tahaan||271||
translation: Ten messengers, who were specialist in their task, were searched and sent to the place where Bharat resided.271.

gurmukhi: aucry sMdys ] aUrD gy AauDys ] p`qR bwcy Bly ] lwg sMgM cly ]272]
transliteration: Ouchre Sandes|| Ooradh Ge Audhes|| Pattra Baache Bhale|| Laag Sanadg Chale||272||
translation: Those messengers delivered the message and told that the king Dasrath had died, Bharat read the letter and accompanied them.272.

gurmukhi: kop jIXM jgXo ] Drm BrmM BgXo ] kwsmIrM qjXo ] rwm rwmM BjXo ]273]
transliteration: Kop Jeeyan Jagyo|| Dharam Bharamannd Bhagyo|| Kaasmderan Tajyo|| Raam Raamannd Bhajyo||273||
translation: The anger blazed in his mind and the sense of Dharma and respect disappeared from it. They left Kashmir (and started on return journey) and began to remember the Lord.273.

gurmukhi: pu`jey Av`D ] sUrmw sn`D ] hyirE AauDys ] miRqkM ky Bys ]274]
transliteration: Pujjae Avaddh|| Soormaa Sanaddh|| Herio Audhes|| Mritakan Ke Bhes||274||
translation: The brave hero Bharat reached Oudh and saw the king Dasrath as dead.274.
Speech of Bharat addressed to Kaikeyi :

gurmukhi: lKXo ksUq ] bu`lXo spUq ] DiRg meIXw qoih ] lij lweIXw moih ]275]
transliteration: Lakhyo Kasoot|| Bullyo Sapoot|| Dharig Maeeyaa Toh(i)|| Laj(i) Laaeeyaa Moh(i)||275||
translation: â€œO mother ! when you saw that the worst had happened and then you called your son; you must be reproached, I feel ashamed. 275.

gurmukhi: kw krXo kukwj ] kXo jIAY inlwj ] moih jYby qhI ] rwm hYgy jhI ]276]
transliteration: Kaa Daryo Koukaaj|| Kyo Jeeai Nilaaj|| Moh(i) Jaibe Tahee|| Raam Haige Jahee||276||
translation: " How is it that you lost all sense of shame ? That you have done such a bad deed; I shall go now where Ram has gone. '276.
